intro: Paratropia tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly paratropia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, woolly stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
